intro: Oxypappus, commonly known as the desert flax, is a genus of flowering plants in the aster family. It is characterized by its small, annual or perennial growth habit and is native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas. The plants typically have hairy stems and leaves, and their flowers are small and clustered in heads. Oxypappus species are adapted to survive in harsh environments with low moisture availability. They are often found in sandy soils and can thrive in areas with limited rainfall.
